text.headline: The Evolution of Gender
text.text: A timeline of significant events from the beginning of the universe to the present day.

text.headline: Early Human Societies
text.text: The period during which the Solar System formed.

text.headline: Ancient Civilizations
text.text: The period during which the Earth and Moon formed.

text.headline: Middle Ages
text.text: The period of human history from approximately 100,000 to 10,000 BCE.

text.headline: Renaissance and Enlightenment
text.text: The period of human history from about 3,000,000 BCE to 100,000 BCE.

text.headline: Renaissance and Enlightenment
text.text: The period of human history from about 3,000,000 BCE to 100,000 BCE.

text.headline: Renaissance and Enlightenment
text.text: The period of human history from about 3,000,000 BCE to 100,000 BCE.

text.headline: Formation of the Solar System
text.text: The Solar System formed approximately 6 billion years ago.

media.caption: Artist's impression of the early Solar System

text.headline: Formation of the Earth
text.text: The Earth formed about 4.5 billion years ago.

text.headline: Formation of the Moon
text.text: The Moon formed shortly after the Earth, possibly as a result of a collision with a Mars-sized body.

text.headline: First Evidence of Life
text.text: The earliest evidence of life on Earth dates back to around 3.5 billion years ago.

text.headline: Emergence of Homo sapiens
text.text: Homo sapiens, the species to which all modern human beings belong, emerged around 100,000 BCE.

text.headline: Cave Paintings in Lascaux
text.text: The famous cave paintings in Lascaux, France, were created around 50,000 BCE.
